data.event: As of the 2010 Census Mesa became Arizona's center of population.
The history of Mesa dates back at least 2,000 years to the arrival of the Hohokam people.
By A.D. 1450, the Hohokam had constructed hundreds of miles of canals many of which are still in use today.
